itemDescription: Scottish cardiologist and professor in sports and exercise medicine (1943-2014)

wikipedia_page.main: William Stewart Hillis  (28 September 1943 − 21 July 2014) was a Scottish physician who held a professorship in cardiology and exercise medicine. He was doctor for the Scotland national football team for 228 full international matches, part of his involvement with football that spanned more than 40 year during his medical career. He was vice-chairman of the UEFA medical committee and medical advisor to FIFA.
